snippet: The deficit for the first two months of the new budget year is down 21 percent, in part because of the calendar shifting payment dates for various government benefits.
abstract: Treasury Dept reports federal government's deficit for first two months of new budget year is down 21 percent from same period year ago; much of improvement is because of quirks in calendar.
lead_paragraph: The deficit for the first two months of the new budget year is down 21 percent, in part because of the calendar shifting payment dates for various government benefits.

headline.main: Calendar Shift Helps in Decline of U.S. Deficit
headline.print_headline: Calendar Shift Helps in Decline of U.S. Deficit
